items: Start by boiling the whole potatoes with skin (but washed so that they do not have soil). _Remember that it is important that the cooking of the potato starts from cold water_.
The potatos are well cooked When pricking them with a fork or knife finding no resistance. It usually takes about 45-60 min.
Let the potatoes cool a little andpeel them when they are warm.
With the help of a rod or fork, crush them and season with virgin olive oil, salt, pepper and nutmeg. Stir well with the rods until obtaining a homogeneous mixture.
Start the recipe by caramelizing the apple. To do this, peel the apples, cut them into quarters and each into three segments to finally cut in half.
In a pan with butter, caramelize the apples until they turn brownish. To help them stay golden brown, add sugar. Then reserve.
In the same frying pan with a dash of soft oil, put the mushrooms to quarters until golden. Season and reserve.
Now brown the whole butifarras over high heat. When having good color, we cut them into three each (_bite size_).
Then continue by add the onion cut into very thin strips (julienne) over low heat and let it confit.
Once the onion is well confited, add the mushrooms and cream. Leave over very low heat, so that the cream is reduced and infused with all the flavors.
Finally, when the cream is reduced to a sauce, add the caramelized apples, already out of the fire, stirring. Ready to serve with two good tablespoons of our mashed potato.
